intro: Rungia wightiana, commonly known as the Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Rungia wightiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
